row.Docu:
= RB name = PCK.AUTOMIC_MSSQL.PUB.ACTION.DROP_DB
= General description = Drops the specified database.
= Inputs = * SQL User : Username used to authenticate with the DB server. * SQL Password : Password used to authenticate with the DB server. * JDBC Connection String : JDBC connection string. E.g.:ÃÂÃÂjdbc:sqlserver://myServer:1433;databaseName=myDB * JDBC Driver JAR URI : URI pointing to the vendor-specific JDBC jar-file. * JDBC Driver Class : Name of the class to load when initializing the JDBC connection. E.g "com.microsoft.jdbc.sqlserver.SQLServerDriver" * Connection Interval : Time interval in seconds during which ARATools.jar tries to establish a connection to the database. * Number of Connection Retries : The number that is specified in this parameter determines how often ARATools.jar tries to connect to the database. After the nth failure, the ARATools ends with a failure code. * Database to drop : Name of the database to create.Note: don't confuse the name of the database to create with the name of the database used in the JDBC connection URL (jdbc:sqlserver://<server_name>:1433;databaseName=<db_name>). the databaseName=... property used to build up the connection to a specific database, should be empty. * Fail if DB not exists : If "yes", the runbook function fails with an error message if the database does not exist
= Behavior = Return 0 if database is created successfully. Return 999 (with SQL exception) if failed because of any exception getting from SQL server. If the database already exist and "Fail if DB not exists" flag set to YES: Return 12 with properly exception "Fail if DB not exists" flag set to NO: Return 0 but still message the object existed Return 4 for other failure
= Outputs = None
= Rollback = None
= Logging = None
= Example = None
